author: Yuliya Talmazan
title: Toddler, wearing only rubber boots, found wandering in Prince George - BC | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 23, 2017 7:09 pm Updated: February 23, 2017 7:13 pm Toddler, wearing only rubber boots, found wandering in Prince George By Yuliya Talmazan Online News Producer Global News 
File photo. File/Global News What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
A young child was found wandering in the streets of Prince George on Wednesday, wearing nothing but rubber boots. 
Cpl. Craig Douglass with Prince George RCMP says at approximately 10:15 a.m., they received a report of a young child found near the corner of Union Street and Youngs Avenue. 
A member of the public working in the area found the three-year-old boy, wandering in the street. 
Police took custody of the child, and a police dog helped lead the officers to the toddler’s home. 
A Canada Post employee helped locate the child’s residence and his caregivers were also located. 
Police say the toddler has been returned to his home, and child welfare authorities have been notified. © 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
